reviews.review: Don't take your kids to see this shitty hipster film that poses as an animated kids movie.

FUCK YOU, SONY!! AND FUCK YOU, AMY PASCAL!!! It's because of THIS SHITTY MOVIE, that we lost a Popeye movie from the man behind Samurai Jack. Cliched and unfunny from beginning to end, The Emoji Movie is torture on every sense of the word. Seriously, this can be a form of torture if required. I hope Sony fails and I hope Amy is fired from her job for being the worst type of person in the film industry...A VILLAIN.
Aside from a good cast, The Emoji Movie is an ultra-boring, stale and all-around awful attempt to attract families.
3/10 NOT ENOUGH EMOJIS PLEASE I WANT TO DIE.
This is going to flop harder than a fat guy on America's Funniest Home Videos.

The Emoji Movie is just what I expected, trash.
The animation is decent, but everything else sticks out like a High Five to the Pinky.
The story being unoriginal is an understatement to every person who saw better, the humor's as low-brow as you'd expect, the message is STUPID  and the characters are either  dull or hate-able.
I can see why people would wanna see this(The decent animation.), but then again, the movie has SO MUCH HATE that you'll probably just trust the critics and skip it.
I won't even recommend you to rage-watch it like I wanted to do, because there's barely anything to laugh at due to how stupid it is!
It just deserves a BURNING MEDALLION OF BADNESS and 1 star!
Story:1|10
Animation: 6|10
Characters:2|10
Overall:3|10.
Also, there was a Hotel Transylvania short before the movie titled "Puppy"  about Dracula getting his son a giant dog.
It's formulaic, the animation's horrible, the humor's usually low-brow and the characters are cliche, but there's ONE saving grace to this WHOLE SHORT.
The ending.
Just watch it.
And now that I've watched Minion Mowers, I have to say that they're actually pretty darn similar.
Think about it:
They're both short films about popular franchises who would get to their third installment(At the time Minion Mowers was  released,DM3 wasn't out.)who come up before a milestone in their studio's careers(For better or for worse.).
This move is going to make $50K, tops. That's my projection
OH BABY!!!!!EMOJI MOVIE BOUT TO MAKE CINEMATIC HISTORY NO JOKE THIS IS GONNA BE THE FILM INDUSTRY'S SAVIOR!!! EMOJI MOVIE 50: A POOP ON THE RISE HERE WE COME!!!!!!!!!

Yep, this movie actually exists. This is what the film industry has come to: an emoji movie. This morning I woke up and checked the Rotten Tomatoes page and I thought, "is there really an emoji movie, or is this a twisted, never ending dream-state hell. Nonetheless, I saw this movie for pure hilariousity. I thought I could atleast have a fun time laughing that this movie exists. And I will say, you can complain about anything in the world, but I spent an hour and a half of my life watching this movie, so you will be fine.
       I'd love to rant about this total abomination all day, but let me talk the legistics. The first thing is the humor: it's painful and unfunny. Most of the jokes are either poop jokes, retired humor from animated movies, or pop culture references, if you can call them that. I sat in this theater and I laughed once in the entire runtime, and the rest of the laughter was kids. This movie has talented voice actors that I really want to give a big hug just because I feel so genuinely bad for them that they had to appear in this film. The voice acting was screaming please get me out of this sound booth and give me my damn money.
       Now like I said earlier, this movie is a deadbeat playback of animated movie tropes. It's a retired plot and retired humor, and it's unbeleivably painful to sit through. It's almost like a 4 year old got their dad's computer and download their favorite animation movies and just slapped them together and put emojis on their faces. I think I could do a better job making this movie at that age. And in the end, it's all about money. Sony doesn't care if this movie is good or bad, they just see it as a movie about emojis so people will see it cause they like emojis. They just treat us like we don't care if a movie is good or bad, we just want EMOJIS. And if that wasn't bad enough, there's so much product placement is this movie. It takes runtime just to explain what Candy Crush is and how to play it!
       Overall, this complete utter abomination of missuse of film is unfunny and painful. This isn't just a kids movie, it's a nobody movie. The voice cast has potential but there's no good humor. It's a painful waste of existence. We just have to accept that to most people, there is no purpose to film making anymore! They just want more money! The Emoji Movie is an undeniably terrible cash cow, and it's already the worst movie of the year, if not of all time. Don't see this disgrace to mankind unless it's that or being brutally beat and slowly tortured to death. The Emoji Movie can be described in one emoji: ??
